data.title: The Label issues
data.body:
Hello, yesterday I've updated libgdx from 1.5.2 to 1.7.0 and have noticed some issues with scene2d.ui Labels.
## Issue 1

Maybe it's intended, maybe not. In 1.7.0 Labels don't have a little space before the first character (actually the part of this character) and after the last one.

Please, see this example. It's a Label added to a table cell. Compare its left and right boundaries as was in the version 1.5.2 and as is in the version 1.7.0.

![space](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10563821/10561560/54c44096-7536-11e5-8f26-c22ed42d8977.png)
## Issue 2 - really bizarre one

When you add a Label to a table cell and set the width of the latter, some characters may become broken...

Here is an example, where I have a table and add a lot of labels into its cells (like table.add(label).width(columnWidth)). Please, notice some strange artifacts in some characters (especially 'F', '5', '6'). The same thing without setting the width is below -- as you can see, all characters there are rendered correctly. Btw the font is 32px size and pregenerated with FreeTypeFontGenerator.

Please, click on the image to see it in full size.

![label_artifacts1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10563821/10561589/6325fcb8-7538-11e5-81cf-3f3c6d2040ce.png)

Another example is with a TextButton and its Label. When simply added to a table, the Label is rendered correctly, but if added followed by fillX(), the artifact appears:

![label_artifacts2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10563821/10561596/e24f3676-7538-11e5-8e6d-d30cd80aee5e.png)

The font is Lato 2.015 Light (Lato-Light.ttf):
http://www.latofonts.com

data.title: Issues requiring a major release that won't be fixed anytime soon
data.body:
What is this? Simply said, this is:
- an invitation not to open new issues implying wide API breakage
- a single collection point for such issues
- a gentle way to let the dev team absorb the idea that sooner or later a major release will be needed :relaxed: 

This is what I collected so far:
- [Immutable Color and Vector](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3424)
- [gdx-utils](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2793)
- [Logging](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/1311) (BTW I think that a logging system separated from `Gdx.app`, for instance `Gdx.logger`, would be much easier to customize)
- [Vulkan](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3344)
- [For consistency's sake use Array in place of ArrayList](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/347)

data.title: SpriteBatch can handle extra attributes
data.body:
I've many times got stuck on the vertex attribute limit that SpriteBatch has, and I often see questions on SO where someone wants to implement an effect that requires more vertex attributes.

Here's a first pass at adding the feature to SpriteBatch so it doesn't have to be cloned to accomplish this. I did it in a way that I **think** adds no runtime overhead when using it in the traditional manner.

I also created an ExpandableSprite class that can be used to manage the extra attributes. It unfortunately does include a lot of cloned code from Sprite, but I think that's unavoidable if Sprite's performance is to be maintained.

The new test shows one way the feature could be used...bump-mapped lighting.

This is a first pass. Open to ideas for making this easier to use.

data.title: (v1.7.0) GlyphLayout.setText.197 - IndexOutOfBoundsException
data.body:
Hi,
I'm having random crashes caused by the GlyphLayout class.

```
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: index can't be >= size: 2 >= 0
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array.get(Array.java:127)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.GlyphLayout.setText(GlyphLayout.java:197)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFontCache.addText(BitmapFontCache.java:494)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFontCache.addText(BitmapFontCache.java:482)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont.draw(BitmapFont.java:208)
```

So, let me be clear from the start: Yes, this issue is most likely related to multi-threading. Now, I understand that libgdx is not thread-safe, but is this a reason to make it so much thread unfriendly?

The issue I'm experiencing here as been described a lot of time now, in #3388, #3369, #3172, etc...
Everytime you close it because "it's just a multithread problem". But wouldn't it be worth looking into the code of GlyphLayout to reduce the occurrence of bugs like this?

GlyphLayout use a `static private final Array<Color> colorStack` and then clears it like this:

``` java
for (int i = 1, n = colorStack.size; i < n; i++)
    colorPool.free(colorStack.get(i));
colorStack.clear();
```

This seems the most _thread unfriendly_ way of doing that. I know libgdx is not thread safe, but given the number of people who have bugs like this, it could be really great to change this colorStack into maybe a member instead of a static or something like that.

Thanks

data.title: Add Renderable#meshPart, MeshPart bounds, rename to #offset and #size
data.body:
**This is an API breaking change**
- Removes the `mesh`, `meshPartOffset`, `meshPartSize` and `primitiveType` members of `Renderable` and adds the `meshPart` member instead. 
- Adds the `center`, `halfExtents` and `radius` members to `MeshPart`.
- Rename `MeshPart#indexOffset` to `MeshPart#offset` and `MeshPart#numVertices` to `MeshPart#size`.

The bounds are (and should be) calculated as soon as possible and not more than needed. In case of `Model` this is when the model is loaded from file or created using `ModelBuilder`. Custom implementation that create `MeshPart` instances should be updated accordingly.

Calculating the bounds of the entire `Model`/`ModelInstance` is not affected by these values. That is still a costly operation that takes into account the node transformation.

The naming (`indexOffset` and `numVertices`) always have been confusing and the actual meaning depends on whether the mesh is indexed or not. Since this is already API breaking change, I thought this would be a good moment to change those names as well. The `offset` is the offset in the mesh to the start of the part and `size` is the size of the part.

_Custom shader changes:_
`MeshPart` now contains a convenience method to easily render the part:

``` java
renderable.meshPart.render(program);
```

For more info about the reason for these changes, see also #3474

data.title: String.replace() used in JsonWriter is extremely slow
data.body: String.replace() clearly isn't suited for a lot of Json serializing every frame (profiler showed that it uses about 6% of the whole frame time in my case). I propose replacing it with what is described here http://stackoverflow.com/a/16229133/1992654

data.title: Fix freetype font loading when using AndroidZipFile
data.body: FreeType fonts look for the sibling of a file, which in case of AndroidZipFile might be in the internal rather the obb file itself. This patch fixes this case and also adds a test inside the APKExpansionTest.

data.title: Fix AndroidZipFileHandle.length() throwing NullPointerException
data.body: If the file doesn't exists AndroidZipFileHandle.length() throws a NullPointerException which is wrong. Looks like the FreetypeFontGenerator uses FileHandle.length() to check if a font is an actual file or has to be generated so that is the most obvious way to catch this.

data.title: BitmapFont bounds issue
Make APK expansion initialization faster. Make exists() faster for files
data.body: It seems that if there are lots of entries in the obb file, exists() is rather slow because it has to search a large HashMap. This should make it much faster.

data.title: Fix bug causing ObjLoader to not load materials with dots in name
data.body: The mtl loader replaces dots with underscored, but ObjLoader does not. Thus ObjLoader is unable to load materials with dots in their name ("Material.001").

data.title: Scene2d TextArea does not scroll by itself or when it is inside a ScrollPane
data.body:
There was a fix posted on stackoverflow that involved setting the preferred rows but it breaks on some cases and is more of a hack.

I've tried the following solutions to no avail:
1. Outer container containing ScrollPane which contains TextArea
Problem: Outright doesn't scroll
2. Outer container and inner container containing TextArea with widths and heights
Problem: Will scroll but as more text is entered it will start deleting old text or something else funkier
3. Setting prefRows to change with the increasing lines in TextArea
Problem: Same issue as #2 but would take longer for that to happen. If you enter a lot of lines you can notice that something is definitely wrong.
